title: BIG BUTTON IN MIDDLE
author: Protodal
content: Anyone know what this button does? The one on the central console

replies.author: Idiot_Style_86
replies.content: Pretty sure its the galaga button. The shapes on the screen could be meteors that youre shooting.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: I think you’re right. If i line up the white dot with the meteor horizontally and hit the button, the meteor goes away.

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: isnt it fucking obvious

replies.author: Daddylus
replies.content: it changes. Check HOW DO I FILL BARS?

title: bars
author: svelsvelkin1
content: Anyone figured out the bars on the screen yet? Surely its different fuel gauges or something similar but we should really nail down what those mean soon.

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: fuel isnt a thing. Its just oxygen and water

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: great yeah dont give any explanation or anything thanks

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: it was pretty obvious when i could literally see air leaking out of my ship and the meter plummeted. When the bottom bar is low, the coffee machine stops working, and the ship seems to get hotter, so thats obviously water

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: great. Wasnt so hard now was it?

title: Radio
author: svelsvelkin1
content: if you click the mousewheel-shaped-thing above the main console you can play a song :-)

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: dude literally nobody cares

title: Spiral Theory
author: Protodal
content: I was messing around last night and had a theory about the infamous spiral indicator: what if its a fuel gauge? I’ve noticed the ship moves considerably slower when the spiral is almost empty, almost like its conserving fuel.

replies.author: Daddylus
replies.content: great find! We’ve suspected for a while that some indicator could represent fuel, but this is my new favorite theory. Now to find how to refuel…

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content:
Ive been waiting for someone to come up with a theory about the spiral for a while now, but I didn’t expect it to be this idiotic.


If fuel was recorded anywhere, it would be on the larger screen where the other levels are tracked (water + oxygen), not on its own arbitrary console. Seeing as the only other indicators on that screen are fluctuating/sinusoidal, neither of them can be fuel, since fuel would only go down in one direction


To give fuel its own, spiral-shaped indicator would be completely unintuitive. The spiral probably indicates something like hull integrity, seeing as a shell typically serves to protect a nautilus’ body.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: youre getting on my nerves, man. Even if you’re right, you could’ve said it a little nicer. Maybe turn on the Radio and calm down.

replies.author: Daddylus
replies.content: Your behavior is uncalled for. If you can’t be polite, you should leave this forum.

title: How do I fill bars?
author: Issuator
content: I think the game ends immediately if you run these bars to zero. What are these? Fuel? If so how do i get more

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: I think fell god figured out the bars yesterday. I think proto had a fuel theory though check his thing on fuel

replies.author: Daddylus
replies.content: its not fuel its oxygen (in one of my playthroughs i got a crack in my hull and the bar started depleting really fast). Certain meteors have oxygen in them that you can pull into your ship

replies.author: Issuator
replies.content: you cant pull in meteors they just destroy you

replies.author: Daddylus
replies.content: destroying the meteors is the same as pulling them in. certain bars get replenished when you destroy certain meteors

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: finally, maybe we can get more than five minutes through the game now LOL

title: coffee weirdness
author: Issuator
content: Are there any game mechanics tied to the coffee machine? Besides pouring the coffee, is there anything else to it?

replies.author: Daddylus
replies.content: Sometimes the coffee machine will turn on by itself, and you can just shut it off by clicking the button.

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: This isn’t always true. Sometimes, when the coffee machine turns on by itself, there will be a popup from Hermes that says something like “Mmmm” or “Delicious!” When this happens, DO NOT TURN OFF THE COFFEE MACHINE!!! If you do, the game will end immediately.

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: One time, the coffee started on its own, but it came out green instead of brown. The only solution to this is to steer your joystick to the right.

title: Side Terminal
author: Issuator
content: Some thoughts on the terminal to the right - the indicator screen seems to go down over time and get replenished seemingly at random. It seems to show some kind of draining resource that you accumulate through gameplay

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: It is very clearly not random…

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: Care to elaborate?

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: I’m getting tired of explaining things to you… The indicator only goes down as you shoot torpedos - it’s obviously an ammo meter. One of the asteroids must be a replenishable resource that helps your ship construct new torpedoes

replies.author: Issuator
replies.content: Wow, I think you might be right!

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: I could have told you that…

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: As annoying as this response is, I think you’re right. I just tested it, and if you deplete the ammo meter, your torpedo button stops working. Still, your elitism is showing. This is a public forum. We’re all on the same side here. Don’t be vague just to be vague.

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: If you wanna cuss me out for being right, you can do it in my DMs.

title: Hermes
author: Protodal
content: Anyone learn what this guy’s point is? Is he like Clippy? You can only click him sometimes.

replies.author: Idiot_Style_86
replies.content: I don’t know, but he’s cute :-) .

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content:
What a perfectly useless statement.

Hermes is just as useless, unfortunately. We don’t need a whole post for him. None of his “advice” is usable in the game.

Probably just a joke meant to Troll players.

replies.author: Idiot_Style_86
replies.content: Delete yourself, please.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content:
I wouldn’t be so sure, personally

I believe Hermes currently exists in two different states: A Liar and a Truthteller. If you receive a pop-up from him in his Truthteller state, you have to follow his instructions to keep yourself alive. In his liar state, however, it is imperative that you do the REVERSE of whatever he is telling you to do.

Although this may seem counterintuitive, I actually quite like him. It seems like he really does care about the ship, except in those instances where he “glitches” and accidentally gives you the wrong advice.

One time, out of nowhere, Hermes said this:
“Sometimes, failure is just as rewarding as success. Don’t get bogged down! Look at the stars. Look how far you’ve come.”

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: Like I said. Useless.

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: I think I’ve figured it out. You can tell between Hermes’ “Liar” and “Truthteller” states by looking closely at his color. During his “Truthteller” events, he will be the same golden color he always is. However, when he is lying, he will be paler.

title: asteroids
author: svelsvelkin1
content:
Here is my grand unified theory of the Derelict asteroids

A lot of people have been speculating about resources in bars and Spiral Theory, but I think I know how you’re supposed to replenish them.

It’s only thanks to speculation by Proto about the asteroids, as well as theories from Proto, fell, and daddylus about the resource indicators, so thanks y’all!

(Reply if you think I’m off base here at all)

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: So far, I think you’re right on the money! After I saw this post, I did some testing, which mostly confirmed this. Well done everybody! We’re far from having solved this game, but this is a huge step.

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: Don’t know why you’re thanking us. It’s literally the whole reason we’re here.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: I believe this is Fell-speak for “Good job!”

replies.author: Idiot_Style_86
replies.content: Don’t the asteroids all destroy you? I’ve just been avoiding them…

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: Daddylus figured this out in How do I fill bars? Destroying the asteroids gives you specific resources.

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: Proto I don’t know how you stay so patient with these people.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: It’s truly a shame that we can’t all be as brilliant as you.

title: Purple
author: Protodal
content: Light outside my cockpit got really bright purple all of a sudden. A couple seconds later, my game ended. Anyone know what the deal with that is?

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: Yes! During purple events, you can look at the main console screen for a purple-tinted meteor. You have to shoot that meteor to end the event. Otherwise, if it sneaks past your ship, you’ll die.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: Ohhh, I understand. Thank you!

title: Button stuff
author: Issuator
content:
Last thread about the side terminal got a little heated, so I’m making a new one. This one is focused on the buttons instead of the indicator, which we’ve settled on being ammo. At first, I didn’t think the long orange button did anything, but if you hold it down long enough, it shuts off the lights in the cockpit.

The button to the left of it also seems to do something, but I’m not sure what yet…

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: I don’t think it’s just a light switch. I just did what you suggested and held down the orange button, and everything turned off: including the screens. Seems more like a power button to me. When you leave it off for more than about 30 seconds, your game ends immediately, like you’ve run out of oxygen or something.

replies.author: Issuator
replies.content: That makes more sense actually. I remember in one of my playthroughs I was randomly clicking buttons and the lights turned off, but not the screens, so that’s a different button I think. I wish I could remember what it was…

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: You turn off the light by… get this… flicking the very obvious light switch on the ceiling under the tree ornament.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: Unrelated, but if your light starts randomly flickering, you can fix it by spamming the power button on-off-on-off several times.

replies.author: Idiot_Style_86
replies.content: Other button is a coffee thing, I think. One time, my coffee machine started dripping coffee like crazy, and hitting that button was the only way to get it to stop. I’m gonna post it in Official Documentation of Obstacle Events probably.

title: Red
author: svelsvelkin1
content: Hello again. I know we were just talking about purple events, but I just got what I think can be called a “Red” event. The window turned a bright shade of red, and only 3 seconds later, my game had ended. Unlike with purple events, there is no “red meteor” to shoot on the meteor screen. Any thoughts?

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: Happened to me earlier today. You need to shut off all power to your ship, and the light will fade away. Once the red is gone, turn your power back on.

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: Huh, interesting… If you don’t mind me asking, how did you know to do that? Feels kind of out-of-nowhere…

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: Why do you care? Last time I checked, we were more concerned with results than reasons. It was obvious, after all. Anyone with a survival instinct would have felt the immediate flight-response of that bright, red light. Anyone except you, of course. Clearly your ancestors let themselves get eaten by dinosaurs instead of hiding behind a rock like they should have.

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: First of all, dick. Second of all, what are you talking about? Why would your first response to a digitally simulated red light be to hide in terror? Are you prone to paranoid delusions?

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: I think we’ve all grown pretty emotionally attached to the first-person perspective of this game. It’s only natural that we would feel fear in response to a potential danger.

title: Official Documentation of Obstacle Events
author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
content:
Somehow, nobody has made a post like this, so just to make everyone’s lives easier, let’s start right now.

I’m sure anyone with half a brain has noticed that certain events are shuffled into every playthrough at an interval of about 10-15 seconds. These events range from mechanical errors to “extraterrestrial” sightings. During these events, you can speak to Hermes, or the computer intelligence, who will be less than helpful, as you are all well aware (well, most of you).

More helpful is an analysis of your surroundings, testing anything and everything you possibly can to address the errors. Whatever you do learn, post here. Immediately. Link to your other threads if need be.

replies.author: Idiot_Style_86
replies.content: Recently, my coffee machine started dispensing coffee like crazy. It wouldn’t stop no matter what I did. But then, I hit the green square button next to the power button, and the coffee shut off.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: It could be just a general “water reset” button, like to recalibrate the water system.

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: I think you’re right. The green button fixes the issue where you can’t turn off your coffee machine. This isn’t always the case, however. Check coffee weirdness.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: I think the Hermes events count as obstacles, since if you ignore them, your ship blows up.

replies.author: Issuator
replies.content: Any idea what to do when the outside is glowing green?

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: It doesn’t mean anything, as far as I’m aware. You can leave it alone. When it glows Purple or Red, on the other hand, you gotta fix it.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: Sometimes, the radio randomly starts and I can’t turn it off. I don’t really mind, and it might just be a glitch, but I figured I’d post it here.

replies.author: Issuator
replies.content: For some reason, slamming the joystick to the left fixes this. It happened to me yesterday. Also, if the radio ever stops suddenly, it’ll come back on once you shoot another torpedo. If you don’t fix the radio, you die, for some reason. Which is kind of stupid but whatever.

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: New incident discovered: Unidentified Flying Object.

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: New incident discovered: Window Alien.

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: Linking to my thread about an event where you suddenly lose all of your fuel. What happened to my fuel ???

title: Joystick not working
author: Daddylus
content: I tried clicking my joystick to the left but it wouldn’t go? It made a noise like a loud *bonk* and my ship promptly crashed into a meteor. Has this happened to anyone else? Or is it a glitch

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: Here! It keeps happening to me. I think fell has been tracking “random events” you should let him know about that. Official Documentation of Obstacle Events

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: Huh, I don’t think my joystick has ever stopped working. I’ll keep my eye out for that.

replies.author: Idiot_Style_86
replies.content: Maybe not with fell god around…

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: I’m gonna go ahead and pretend you didn’t say that…

title: Unidentified Flying Object
author: Protodal
content: I saw a UFO outside of the window today as I was fiddling with the game during work. I kept playing as usual, but it killed me. Anyone figure out how to deal with this?

replies.author: Idiot_Style_86
replies.content: You don’t have to do anything, I don’t think. When it showed up for me, nothing happened.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: Huh. Maybe I’m mistaken? Not sure.

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content:
Do NOT listen to Idiot_Style_86 no matter what you do.

If you ignore the ship, there is a very good chance they will kill you. Don’t let them do this. They are very dangerous.

If you see them, turn on your radio. If the radio sounds normal, then you do not have to do anything. The ship will pass you by and they won’t care. However, if the radio sound is garbled, whatever you do, do NOT destroy any of the asteroids. The ship is scanning your general area for usable resources, and if they see you take resources that they want for themselves, they will not hesitate to destroy you.

Tread carefully. Danger is everywhere.

replies.author: Idiot_Style_86
replies.content: Hey dude, are you okay? You sound fucking crazy.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: Fell, I think you might be getting a little too invested in the game. Take care of yourself, please. I don’t want you to let this consume you.

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content: Answer my DMs, please.

title: Window Alien
author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
content: Please tell me you all see this too. I feel like I’m going crazy. There is a fucking scary alien outide. I know it saw me. I turned off the lights and I think it lost interest in me. I’m gonna die.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content:
You’re not crazy, I’ve seen it too. I didn’t know the solution was turning off the lights, though, so I’ll try that next time.

But come on, dude. You can’t be obsessing with this stuff at 5 in the morning. You’ll destroy your brain. Give yourself a break, get some rest. I’ll be waiting for you in the morning.

replies.author: Protodal
replies.content: It’ll *** It’ll be waiting for you *** I meant to say It’ll.

title: What happened to my fuel ???
author: svelsvelkin1
content: For some reason, my fuel tank suddenly shot all the way down to half, then to a quarter, then to empty, all within the space of about five seconds. It was way quicker than it usually goes down and I barely had time to react. Am I really expected to collect a fuel asteroid in time?

replies.author: Xx_Fell_God_xX
replies.content:
The answer is within you. It is within the game. It is within everyone. Reach for the joystick. Move it left and right. This will jostle the fuel tank back into place.

For the longest time, I wondered why Derelict hides itself from us, why we must struggle against its labyrinthine design. But if you just listen to it, if you let yourself fall into its warm embrace, you’ll hear its heartbeat. And you’ll know what to do.

replies.author: svelsvelkin1
replies.content: Yo how the fuck did you type that in one second.

title: HELP NOW! He’s gone, and I don’t know why
author: Protodal
content:
I’m sorry to be posting this in the Gameplay tab, but since it’s the most well-trafficked area of the website, I knew I had no choice.

I can’t find Fell. He won’t reply to my messages. He never goes this long without responding.

Something is wrong with him. He hasn’t been the same recently. If you see him online, please let me know immediately.

I’m scared. I miss him.
